clinical_study.brief_title: Retinal Vein Occlusion and Obstructive Sleep Apnea: A Case Control Study
clinical_study.official_title: Retinal Vein Occlusion and Obstructive Sleep Apnea: A Case Control Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study purpose is to evaluate the association between Retinal Vein Occlusion and Obstructive Sleep Apnea.

detailed_description.textblock:
There will be two groups of 50 patients. One with Retinal Vein Occlusion, and the other one, with no Retinal Vein Occlusion will be chosen from the consultation.
The compared group will be paired on different criteria including hypertension, ocular hypertension, diabetes, sex, age.
They will all spend a night at home with a Sleeping Monitor (Nox T3) in order to evaluate if they have an Obstructive Sleep Apnea.

primary_outcome.description: Obstructive Sleepin Apnea diagnostic depends only on the AHI which is measured by the Sleeping Monitor at home.

secondary_outcome.description: High Risk of Sleep Apnea Syndrome: If there are 2 or more Categories where the score is 2 or above Low Risk of Sleep Apnea Syndrome: If there is only 1 or no Categories where the score is 2 or above

arm_group.description: Patient with no Retinal Vein Occlusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients with an Retinal Vein Occlusion for one group (patients)
- All patients with no Retinal Vein Occlusion for the other group (control)
Non-inclusion Criteria:
- minor
- Severe Insomnia
- Neuromuscular Disease with respiratory muscle impairment
- Chronic opioid medication
- Pregnancy women.
- Patient under guardianship
